title: Unlock all champions in ARAM
body:
Currently ARAM is very unsatisfying to win most of the time. I believe far too much is decided by strong team compositions. The average player doesn't have a large champion pool leading to repeat champions a lot of the time, which in turn leads to strong/broken team compositions. Nothing is more frustrating then feeling like you can do nothing in a game that is supposed to be random. Many of my friends who play with me, own a small amount of champions which also leads to the inability to trade away champions they do not like. ARAM should be about making the best of a random situation as a team, verses just praying that you land an op in your team comp. And who knows perhaps it will help players discover new champions to play, outside of the random 10 per week.

Provided the new changes are not reverted, this might be a simple and fun solution to a game mode that is currently **not** very random.

A person who has played far too many arams.
Tylas

Even the best players have comfort picks, and sometimes that is even better than forcing themselves to play the meta, as long as it isn't something troll like Urgot or Aatrox.

There is also the fact that the matchmaking system, regardless if it is ranked or not, attempts to balance the teams around their skill levels. In normals it does this better, because you aren't trying to rank up or anything so it won't be placing you against higher skilled opponents.

Standing on equal ground before champ select, and then seeing that they got completely outdrafted without any say other than rerolls in the matter is pretty irritating.

I agree with a lot of your points, but do understand, aram is meant to be played for fun or to take a break from ranked, and it isn't fun when the odds are stacked heavily against you.

yet again another player that doesn't seem to understand "random"
1. - Random isn't always "fair" or "balanced" so there will be times matches are lopsided.
2. - The "All" in "All Random All Mid" has never meant "All Champions" and instead has always meant "All Players".
3. - Given that not everyone has big champ pools and every has access to whatever is in the weekly rotation, of course you are going to see the same champions often, but that in no way means it isn't random.
The point is the _AMOUNT_ of random can be changed, by having aram accounts that only have the most op champions plus weekly rotation on it.

and yet it doesn't matter if your dice is 6-sided or if you roll a D-20, it is still random, which is my point against these "it's not true random unless all champs are available" arguments I see here.
